hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is

is control the currency manipulate the
economy collapse the economy let's get

news now I titled this report control
the currency manipulate the economy then
collapse the economy because we know
this is what the central bank does now
the central bank uses other parts of the
government they use the corporate media
they use other factions within
government now of course they get free
money they get tips they get insider
trading tips and most of these
individuals become very very wealthy in
government and what they like to do is
they like to put out manipulated
information the corporate media loves to
do this they'll tell you that all retail
is doing the best that we've ever seen
in our lifetime this is exactly what
retailers needed the retail apocalypse
has been called off everything is great
the economy's doing fine and when you
really look at these numbers we see that
something doesn't make sense now yes
retail has ticked up a little bit and it
didn't mean expectations of what they
thought December was going to be like
now sales growth was about 0.3%
month-on-month does that sound really
that great no it doesn't because what we
need to do is we need to go back in time
a little bit if we go back to last
holiday season 2016 going into 2017 they
had headlines out there and one of the
headline says retail sales jump in
December on strong car and online
shopping retail sales increased by 0.6
percent from a revised point two percent
now let's think about that for a second
they're telling us and this was last
holiday season where we reported that
the holiday season was a complete
disaster
they were telling us that the retail
industry grew by 0.6% now first they had
the numbers out of 0.2% and then revised
them to 0.6%
and then in the year of 2017 stores
closed down this year we're getting an
increase of 0.3%
hmm very interesting what does that tell
us it tells us these numbers are
manipulated and if we go by what
happened last year and we look at this
year you know this number is much much
lower you know they're gonna revise it
and make it seem like you know retail
was that point eight percent but once
again you have to understand sales does
not equal profits just because sales are
at point three percent doesn't mean
these stores made a profit maybe their
profit margin maybe they had to put
these things on sale and they only made
a dollar from each sale can the store
stay open no and then we break it down
even further and we look at some of the
sales like electronics well on the
mother December they were down by
negative 0.2 percent that's not good we
look at clothing clothing accessories
down- 0.3 percent we look at Sporting
Goods hobby book and music stores they
were down negative 1.6 percent
miscellaneous store retailers were down
negative 2.9 percent general merchandise
stores department stores negative 1.1
percent there were some places where
sales were up motor vehicle parts point
four percent we see furniture was up
point six percent but the things that
you purchase for the holiday season it
seems like those were all down but we're
getting these sales numbers and we'll go
with them again we're not getting the
actual numbers from the stores and those
are gonna be very very different now
they're trying to convince us and they
keep putting out by the way those you
know those credit card numbers where oh
look it's up by four point nine percent
it's not really up by four point nine
percent because you need to look at the
past numbers and if you look at the past

like to put out those numbers anyhow now
while all this is going
on savings is at a ten-year low people
have no savings and if you take this a

2007 going into 2008 we're at that same

the retailer's it was very close to the

that revised at two point six percent
these point you know percentage numbers
are ridiculous anyhow because the sales

facing bankruptcy and this is coming
from credit risk monitor and we know
that there are other stores montón Sears

that debt and then this is where stores
get into trouble again sales and profits
are two separate things and we're
looking at this economy and it is
completely manipulated to make you think

that everything was great this is what
they do they manipulate what is really
going on because they want everyone all
in because when everyone is all in this
is when they pull the plug and the
economy comes down it's the same exact

and when I say they it's the central
bank we see the core consumer prices
they have risen faster than expected
and once again inflation is rising
they're using a lot of manipulation to
make us believe that inflation is not

seeing it with many other things food
and many other things where we see

oh the stock market they also offloaded

and we can see that as we look at this

debunked that a long time ago and what
we when we look at this we can see that
Wells Fargo mortgage application
pipeline plunged by a whopping 23% to
just twenty three billion I mean we're
almost back to the financial crisis
level I mean this is unbelievable
and we could see that this isn't getting
any better and this has been declining
since 2012 and it had a little pop up
but the trajectory is downward now when
we look at the bank's consumer loan
trends
these reveal that they of cycling credit
cards the there's a huge decline in
credit demand and people are not taking

the fourth quarter of 2016 third quarter
2017 fourth quarter of 2017 it's
declining other revolving credit
installments is declining and what these
numbers disturbingly reveal is that the
average US consumer cannot afford to
take out mortgages at a time when rates
rise by as little as 1% it also means
that if the Fed is truly intended
engineering a parallel shift in the
curve of two to three percent the u.s.
can kiss its domestic housing market
goodbye what what this means is is that
if these rates move up it's going to
knock thousands upon thousands of people
out of the housing market which means
the housing market is going to crash hmm
didn't we see this before we did back in
2006-2007 when they were raising the

mortgages just left their home because
it didn't matter if they refinance it
the rates were too high it pushed
millions of people out of the housing

that had a domino effect on the rest of

upon billions of dollars guess what
people the same thing is happening now
but it's much much worse now bill Dudley
he is the second most important person

doubled the debt in a decade there was

now what Trump is doing he's setting up

not to bring back manufacturing so we

and it is a race right now on who is

who's gonna pass the finish line first

the central bank wants to bring it down

who are trying to take control Trump is

once the system resets and that's where
